java/liquibase/change/InsertDataChange.java

00001 package liquibase.change;
00002 
00003 import liquibase.database.Database;
00004 import liquibase.database.sql.InsertStatement;
00005 import liquibase.database.sql.SqlStatement;
00006 import liquibase.database.structure.DatabaseObject;
00007 import liquibase.database.structure.Table;
00008 import liquibase.exception.UnsupportedChangeException;
00009 import liquibase.exception.InvalidChangeDefinitionException;
00010 import liquibase.util.StringUtils;
00011 import org.w3c.dom.Document;
00012 import org.w3c.dom.Element;
00013 
00014 import java.util.*;
00015 
00019 public class InsertDataChange extends AbstractChange implements ChangeWithColumns {
00020 
00021     private String schemaName;
00022     private String tableName;
00023     private List<ColumnConfig> columns;
00024 
00025     public InsertDataChange() {
00026         super("insert", "Insert Row");
00027         columns = new ArrayList<ColumnConfig>();
00028     }
00029 
00030     public String getSchemaName() {
00031         return schemaName;
00032     }
00033 
00034     public void setSchemaName(String schemaName) {
00035         this.schemaName = StringUtils.trimToNull(schemaName);
00036     }
00037 
00038     public String getTableName() {
00039         return tableName;
00040     }
00041 
00042     public void setTableName(String tableName) {
00043         this.tableName = tableName;
00044     }
00045 
00046     public List<ColumnConfig> getColumns() {
00047         return columns;
00048     }
00049 
00050     public void setColumns(List<ColumnConfig> columns) {
00051         this.columns = columns;
00052     }
00053 
00054     public void addColumn(ColumnConfig column) {
00055         columns.add(column);
00056     }
00057 
00058     public void removeColumn(ColumnConfig column) {
00059         columns.remove(column);
00060     }
00061 
00062     public void validate(Database database) throws InvalidChangeDefinitionException {
00063         if (StringUtils.trimToNull(tableName) == null) {
00064             throw new InvalidChangeDefinitionException("tableName is required", this);
00065         }
00066 
00067         for (ColumnConfig column : getColumns()) {
00068             if (StringUtils.trimToNull(column.getName()) == null) {
00069                 throw new InvalidChangeDefinitionException("column name is required", this);
00070             }
00071         }
00072     }
00073 
00074     public SqlStatement[] generateStatements(Database database) throws UnsupportedChangeException {
00075 
00076         InsertStatement statement = new InsertStatement(getSchemaName() == null?database.getDefaultSchemaName():getSchemaName(), getTableName());
00077 
00078         for (ColumnConfig column : columns) {
00079             statement.addColumnValue(column.getName(), column.getValueObject());
00080         }
00081 
00082         return new SqlStatement[]{
00083                 statement
00084         };
00085     }
00086 
00087     public String getConfirmationMessage() {
00088         return "New row inserted into " + getTableName();
00089     }
00090 
00091     public Element createNode(Document currentChangeLogFileDOM) {
00092         Element node = currentChangeLogFileDOM.createElement("insert");
00093         if (getSchemaName() != null) {
00094             node.setAttribute("schemaName", getSchemaName());
00095         }
00096 
00097         node.setAttribute("tableName", getTableName());
00098 
00099         for (ColumnConfig col : getColumns()) {
00100             Element subNode = col.createNode(currentChangeLogFileDOM);
00101             node.appendChild(subNode);
00102         }
00103         return node;
00104     }
00105 
00106     public Set<DatabaseObject> getAffectedDatabaseObjects() {
00107         Table dbObject = new Table(getTableName());
00108 
00109         return new HashSet<DatabaseObject>(Arrays.asList(dbObject));
00110     }
00111 
00112 }
